results.title: Dodge your debts
results.brief_description: A fast paced slapstick farce starring Gaylord Lloyd (Harold Lloyd’s brother). Set in England, involves a debt collector, scores of bobbys, a pub, a thug and his beautiful daughter. Cast also includes William Gillespie, Estelle Harrison, George Rowe.

results.title: Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Michael Curtiz (Mildred Pierce, Casablanca, Angels with dirty faces) directed this star vehicle for Errol Flynn with whom he collaborated the year before on “The Adventures of Robin Hood”. In “Dodge City” Flynn plays Wade Hatton, a successful and scrupulous man who, with a loyal crew in tow, herds buffalo across Texas to various destinations. On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.

results.title: Documenting Addicus
results.brief_description: An interactive work featuring the day-today experiences of Addicus, an eccentric and lonely young man, reflected both in moving image and in text through his diary.

results.title: Documentary: 1948 - 1976
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Herman J. Engel and Sonya Freidman
results.brief_description: Part three of a three part compilation history of the documentary film. This part presents films from 1948-1976. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary film style, content and construction. Before eac of the documentaries presented, there is an introduction that place the film historically.

results.title: Documentary of achievement
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the South African Iron and Steel Industrial Corporation. The film illustrates the growth of the vast iron and steel company and shows the part it has played in the development of South Africa through two generations in both peace and war. Contains excellent footage of construction of vehicles and ammunition for the war and some spectacular dangerous footage as well.

results.title: Documentary
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Herman J. Engel and Sonya Friedman
results.brief_description: A compilation film of major sequences from famous documentaries. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary style, content and construction. A brief introduction prior to each segment provides a historical context. This film is also available for loan in 3 parts: 1922-1939 (506297), 1935-1955 (506298), 1948-1976 (506299).

results.title: Doctors and patients
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Video and David A. Tapper
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
This film is one of a series of six programs that address the major problems people face in coping with serious illness. The series is hosted by actress, Meryl Streep. This particular program examines the unique relationship that develops between a doctor and a dying patient and looks at the case of Joan Robinson, a woman dying of cancer. Cast also includes Meryl Streep.

results.title: Doctors and nurses
results.creator_credit: Universal Entertainment, Finn Productions, Brian Rosen and Maurice Murphy
